byline.contributor: Leslie Picker contributed reporting, and Amie Tsang contributed research.

abstract: ZTO Express, delivery company that has become key player in China's huge e-commerce boom, raises unexpectedly high $1.4 billion in its initial public offering of stock; is largest American debut by a Chinese company since $25 billion stock sale by Alibaba Group in 2014.
lead_paragraph: The delivery company connects retailers with shoppers in a vast market. It raised $1.4 billion in the biggest Chinese I.P.O. in America since Alibaba’s.
snippet: The delivery company connects retailers with shoppers in a vast market. It raised $1.4 billion in the biggest Chinese I.P.O. in America since Alibaba’s....

headline.main: ZTO Express of China Has Largest U.S. I.P.O. This Year
headline.print_headline: A Chinese Firm Delivers Packages and the Year’s Largest I.P.O. in the U.S.
